intro: Daphniphyllum timorianum, commonly known as the Timor holly, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. It produces berries that are red when mature, which are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
